topic_or_construct: employees' willingness to return to workspaces
measured_by: five-item Likert scale on willingness to return
justification: The article states that "the dependent variable of interest was respondents' willingness to return to workspaces and consists of five items (α = .73)… Response scales ranged from 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree)."

measured_by: three-item Likert scale on infection, hospitalization, or death of close contacts
justification: Under "Network Exposure to COVID-19" the authors note that "three items were used to measure the extent to which individuals in an employees' personal or work network were infected, hospitalized, or died due to COVID-19 (α = .70)."

topic_or_construct: anticipated provision of personal protective equipment
measured_by: single Likert item on likelihood employer will provide PPE
justification: In describing organizational strategies, the survey asked respondents to rate "provisions of personal protective equipment" on a scale from 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree).

measured_by: single Likert item on likelihood employer will use disinfection protocols
justification: The same section lists "disinfection protocols" as one of the organizational COVID-19 transmission control strategies rated by employees using the 1–5 agreement scale.

measured_by: single Likert item on likelihood employer will conduct daily health scans
justification: Employees also indicated the anticipated likelihood of "daily health scans," which was measured with a Likert-type agreement item.

measured_by: single Likert item on likelihood employer will limit attendance by sick employees
justification: The survey included "discouragement of presenteeism" (i.e., compensation policies limiting attendance by sick employees) as another strategy, rated on the same 1–5 Likert scale.
